text: It was my first time there, saw the "basil spicy jumping rice", liking spicy food I asked about it and the waitress said it was one of her favorites, so I ordered it... extra, extra spicy.  And man did it deliver! Super awesome flavor with a great kick!  It is nice to be able to order spicy and actually get it.  Will be going back again :-)

Yay! A new place my toddler and I can enjoy for our lunch dates. I ordered the Crunchy Dragon Roll and the Crispy Chicken Mayo Bowl. We ate there but I requested it "to go" because we usually have leftovers. The lady taking my order was happy to accommodate. You order at the counter, they give you a number, and they bring it out to you. The Crispy Chicken Mayo Bowl was a generous serving; plenty for lunch the next day. The Crunchy Dragon Roll was very good also. On this particular afternoon, the service was a bit slow but we were not in a hurry. The ladies were apologetic. I also liked their demeanor. I felt welcomed and valued as a customer. There are plenty of dishes on the menu that look very good. Looking forward to trying more.

Love this place! Everything is delicious & the portion sizes are great. I go to the LVAC nearby & after my workout I love getting their teriyaki bowl to go. They put the sauce on the side, so I can keep it healthy & the amount of protein you get is worth the price. Also, their cucumber salad for $3 is a steal!

Good lunch, kimchi nice and spicy. This place specializes in friend rice dishes and sushi. Portions are generous and everything I have tried so far has tasted good. Definitely recommend, now part of my weekly lunch rotation.

This place is a gem in the desert.  Soup, Salad and the Entr√©e for about 7 dollars and change .  Now that's a lunch special.  Clean, courteous and the food was very good.  I'll be back quite often and suggest that if you have a craving for Rice plates or Sushi rolls (many to choose from) give Jumping Rice and Rolls a visit.  You'll be glad you did.
Great place, usually I go after the gym where I can find fast, delicious and healthy food. the stuff is very nice as well.

Tried this place last night and had to go back again tonight.  Teriyaki Chicken Bowl is amazing!  Salmon Bowl even better! Jumpin Rice w/ chicken fantastic!  My only negative is the staff is not very friendly or knowledgeable...When you have a different concept you need to educate your staff, so they can in turn educate the customer.  Looking forward to trying the sushi next time.  Definitely put this place on your rotation.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!  The food is amazing - I have tried most of the menu and have enjoyed all of it!  The best part about this place is the service - I come in a lot and all of the girls know me and remember my favorites! Between the great food and the service you cannot beat it!

My favorite dish is their Basil Spicy Jumping Rice with Angus Beef dish. I've had other items on their menu and liked most of them. I also like their Spicy Garlic Edamame, I just happen to like the Basil Spicy dish best. The ambiance is nice enough for a casual or first date and their staff is extremely friendly. I wish they had a location on the east side of Las Vegas too!

Great sushi and great fried rice. Customer service was very good which I don't typically find here in Las vegas. The girls at the counter were SOOO friendly and helpful! I really enjoyed the food and the place was very clean and nicely decorated. Great place for quick Asian food as you order at the counter rather than waiting for a server. LOVED IT!
I have been on a winning streak on good food!! This place is yet another great spot! Might have to make this place a weekly stop. And such friendly staff!
This was absolutely amazing the food is so flavorful I really recommend any and everyone go eat at this place. I'm going back as soon as I can honestly it beats anything I ever ate here so far.
Shrimp tornado with cream cheese is amazing. The staff are nice and friendly. Place is clean and very nice. Not much to say. Probably my favorite sushi joint

Just checked this place out on Friday and both dishes I tried (the rolley rice bowl and crab jumping rice, made with thick noodles) were so full of yumminess I can't wait to go back and try more!  Service was fast and friendly, seating was clean and comfortable.  Definitely a five-star experience all around!

Excellent spicy basil fried rice and dragon rolls!!( trust me there are very few places that makes it right) 

Definitely a regular place for dinner take-out!  Portions are huge. 

Staff members were very nice to bring food.
This place is officially my favorite place to eat. I am hooked to the point that I crave it like a crack head. The place is clean and the staff is great.

Ok first off YUM. And second OMG it's delicious. I got the mayo chicken bowl with white rice and fried egg. I also ordered an avocado roll and loved every moment of my meal experience. It was so good that I had it for lunch and am going back for dinner!
This spot is so great. Cute service, green tea ice cream with matcha in the bowl too!?! What?! I love it

Omg ! First time here and grabbed a mini teriyaki salmon bowl & let me tell you it was soooo yummy !  My classmate got the beef and it was so juicy and so flavorful ! It just tasted like good quality wholesome food for a great price !! I'm gonna be coming here more often ! You guys have won my heart ! They have sushi rolls also !

Pretty bad across the board. I wouldn't go back. Fish quality was low and even basics weren't done well. Decor adds nothing to the experience. I don't understand how this place could have 4.5 stars --- I just assume the reviews have been manipulated though I didn't bother spot checking to see - regardless, that reaction tells you what I thought of the food and experience.
Major sushi lover! This place was definitely not a disappointment. Probably the best sushi I have ever had. Will definitely be going back

Definitely my go too place when in the area and craving tempura! I love, love there batter and size of shrimp they use. Good tempura sauce and like the size and variety of tempura vegetables. It helps balance out everything and I enjoy it with regular white rice, they offer other rice options for those who want to be healthier. But hey many Asians in the world who live long and eat white rice daily, who am I to say white rice is unhealthy, moderation is the key..hehe
I also like there jumping rice, especially with pork, but many protein options.

I've been Here a couple of times.

Had the Tuna Ninja roll (I think that's what it was called), and shared the cucumber salad, spicy garlic edamame, rolley rice, egg rolls, and crush roll.  Really liked all of it but the crush roll - way too heavy on the mayo for my taste but it got my sister to step outside her comfort zone and try anything to do with sushi for the first time.

Fish is really fresh so no disappointment there.  It can be a bit pricey so watch yourself as you start adding things to your order.

First time trying their rice. Family recommended it. Had the crab jumping rice. It was a soft shell crab laying over the fried rice with crab mixed with the rice. Unique and tasty. Fresh, decent price and fast take out. A little oily though. Take out containers are good quality and can be reused. Hope they do well and open other locations.

How often do you order a dish with crab at an asian restaurant and you end up getting imitation crab? ALL THE TIME! The crab fried rice is amazing at this place and they use huge pieces of real crab meat. The rice is so good that you don't need anything else with it.
Hands down the BEST FRIED RICE in town. Their appetizers have also impressed me with their flavor. Great friendly staff & vibe - check them out!
Excellent! Quick Japanese bistro, easy and fast. I love the kid's menu very friendly for families. Great Staff!

Worst sushi I've ever had. Looked and tasted like it was two days old and had been sitting in a fridge. And I'm not sushi picky. I literally couldn't finish it. I will never come here again. The only saving grace was the chicken fried rice was decent.

Fabulous food! Excellent prices and very fresh!
Clean, take out type atmosphere but offers seating as well. We drive quite a distance to eat here.
Food is DELICIOUS!  I had the crab jumping rice along with the salmon blossom. I ate the entire thing ! I can't wait till tomorrow so i can come back and try something different.

Stumbled upon this place while looking for a casual place to have a quick lunch. Was pleasantly surprised. The quality of food was at the calibre of a trendy sit-down Asian fusion place, but at a price that was comparable to a fast food joint. Portions were very filling, but they also were high in quality. Where many restaurants skimp out on the expensive ingredients, we were impressed by the amount of crab in the "jumping crab" dish and the seafood mix in the creamy, rich "dynamite bowl". Wish this had more locations because this restaurant is way above the standard, overly saturated market of cheap-quality Asian food of yesterday.

So freakin yummy!!
We had the Shrimp Tornado, Volcano, and California Roll. All were amazing and I was shocked at the California Roll's awesome flavor and texture. That's usually a 'gimme' type of roll but this one rocked! Also ordered a bowl of white rice for my 2yo and it was really yummy and fresh! Will definitely be coming back!

Love this place. Poki Salad is soooo yummy. At first I was hesitant about the place because it was more of a fast food environment. Although the decor was nice and you can tell they put thought into it. But the food and serve amazed me. Definitely a place I will be going to on a weekly basis.

The Yelp rating was 4.5 stars...  that's why I chose this place.  The food was average.  I got a Salmon rice bowl, it was just rice and steamed salmon.  I also has the seafood salad, a very basic bunch of lettuce and 6-7 thin pieces of fish.

I've been coming here since Jumping Rice and Rolls opened, and the good news is that the food has been consistently good over time. 

But for some bizarre reason, the made the decision to experiment with serving food in PAPER PLATES AND PLASTIC CONTAINERS.  I can't understand the logic behind this. It's got to be more expensive, they already own all the real plates, and it certainly creates way more waste. Not to mention the fact that it makes the place seem absurdly cheap. I probably won't come back if they keep this up, which is kind of a bummer because we like the food. But if I'm going to go out to eat, I don't want to eat off paper plates.
good food!!! great service and quality food at their pricing. I just wish they open early like 930 or something for emergency brunch. so far so good!
I love this place!! Spicy monster roll is my fave, but i always get it to go so that the spicy sauce is on the side and i get to control how much i want to use of it.

In my dream world this amazing incredible place would deliver!!!   

Great, fresh sushi!!

Service is great and friendly and the food is awesome. If you prefer noodles over rice then i suggest thick noodles. They are juicy and taste fresh. I tired the thin noodles but they seemed a little dry for my taste. Also the cucumber island roll is just amazeballs. Love coming here for a quick bite.

placed a call to order for pick up at 930 p.m there was no pick up luckily im a yelper so i did further investigation and went to their website to find out they did close at 10 pm so i call back this time i get thru . so i continue to place my order for pick up which was the following : Crab jumping rice & thai pineapple chow mein w/shrimp and add beef which i was told was 3 dollars extra . i arrive to pick up my food decided i wanted to order thee tempura shrimp which was 3 for 5$ they arrived fresh and pleasing . Enjoyed those while there then took my to go bag home only to get home to notice my thai pineapple had the beef i paid extra for but not the shrimp that originally came with . When i noticed of course they were already closed but since i remembered from calling earlier there was an answering service so i decided to call leave my msg with a return #. Waited a whole day no response now its the next day of course no response so now time to review their business .... food was good i did enjoy but because of thee POOR service i will not return . I also noticed when picking up my food i was not given a receipt but the total reflects that i was charged for food i did not receive . No callback to the customer either means they dont care about your business after they have your $$$
Always quick easy and delicious... we also appreciate that they allow us to special order things, such as no oil, etc. The people there are always very helpful and friendly.

Been there a couple more times now... Called ahead both times..... By the time I get in the are and drive 10 minutes over, my order is ready for pick up... Favorite dish, so far is the Mayo Chicken... Awesome!

Wonderful sushi place! The fishing bowl and cucumber island are so good!! Also the servers are very friendly! The to-go packages are nice! I came here several times! Always my first choice to get to-go Japanese food

My fave sushi restaurant. My coworkers and I eat here at least once a week since our office is in the complex. Delicious fast
and reasonably priced sushi. Daniella always takes care of us and my family when we come in. She knows our order by heart (salmon paradise best kept secret) So lucky to have this great place and people next door!!

Jumping rice and rolls...idk what jumped out at me. Ordered the crispy chicken mayo bowl lunch special for pick up. Bland. Thank God for Sricacha!  makes everything better lol. Soup bowl was filled up below half way. Like my sis say "you got me f*ckeddd up" lol. ** so all in all. We didn't jump, we hopped :)

Service is great! The ladies were very nice and service was quick. My boyfriend and I came here for lunch and were able to take advantage of their lunch special. We ordered the kimchi fried rice and the spicy tuna and spicy salmon rolls. Nothing stellar about the rolls just good ol' simple rolls. The meal also came with miso soup and salad for the both of us. Their kimchi fried rice was really good (even though I'm not a fan of Kimchi). We actually had enough to be able to take half of the fried rice home and I don't know why but it tasted even better as leftovers! Will definitely be coming back here the next time I have a fried rice craving :)

We love this place!  Even with a picky eater in the family, they remember little details when we order!  Customer service is great and food is always fresh and delicious! Love the modern look inside and always good music playing! Check them out!

This place gave us food poisoning!

We went to this place last night and an hour after we left my mother felt sick and started throwing up, then 30 minutes later it hit me worse throw up.. And I'll spare you the details, same to my husband and step father. We ate something bad, we had tiger roll, Alaska roll, poke salad and cucumber island. I wish this place would just give us our money back we spent like $70, just to get sick!
It's ok.  The pictures don't match the food they serve.  It's like fast food sushi.  But that kimchi fried rice was super good.

Good place. Quick place for noodles/rice/sushi. I think the price is fair. They carry coke products. The edamame is yummy. I usually get jumping bowl with noodles. 

Service is always great!

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE THIS PLACE! When I worked next door I would go to Jumping Rice and Rolls everyday for lunch! I've had every roll on the menu and they are all fantastic! If you like sashimi try the rainbow roll, it's amazing!!!!

Order at the counter, they have sushi, soups,noodle dishes, and beer! Pretty awesome place! Foods good and a chill spot  for yourself or a friend getting a quick bite. Fried goyza is on point! Love knowing this local spot is 5min from me!

Jumping Rice & Rolls is categorized as Asian Fusion on Yelp. We felt like venturing something new that night.

We sampled Jumping Rice with Angus Beef and Sashimi Salad. I was able to sense the bulk of MSG in Jumping Rice, and the sashimi in the salad was stale.

Even though I didn't expect anything fabulous, 4.5 stars for this place is questionable enough to doubt what's going on with Yelp.

Did we just get the wrong item?

This place is a pretty good sit-down restaurant with bowls, sushi and rice. Everything i've tried on the menu is delicious! Their rolls are really good although, it isn't all you can eat. Dinning area is clean and they also provide excellent service.

I cant give it -1 stars or i would. I got nothing but rice in my food. And about 6 pieces of chicken that were the size of a dime and it cost $10.  I spent $65 for 4 people. And it was the worst food i have ever had. I would rather go to teriyaki madness. Better cheaper food

I'll make this short and simple: I come here because it's close to the 215/Flamingo LVAC. If you need carbs, nearly everything has rice. If you want omega-3s, opt for sushi; if you want protein, get a rice bowl; and vegetarians have a few options, too. And if you're on a budget, they have lunch specials $6-9 until 3PM.

 I come for the sushi, and get one of their riceless rolls. Frankly, I'm surprised they have any (given the name), but you're limited to three options: volcano (fried roll, which I don't do), cucumber crush (spicy), or cucumber island (favorite). Almost all special rolls are a flat $9, or they have a lunch with two basic rolls for the same price. 

This spot is usually pretty empty, but always clean. Service is fine, takeout is ready fast. It's not stellar sushi, but for the convenience and freshness, the price is right.
I thought this was a restaurant but it's actually more like a fast food asian food. Nothing wring with that as the food here is great. It taste n looks great. My new favorite spot to go now.

Fresh food-reasonable priced-great service. OK. This is funny. We rolled into the parking lot on our way to try out 5Guys Burgers. On our way from the car we spotted this place and peered in the window. It wasn't busy, but we wondered in and they were awesome. My gluten free friend got the Pineapple Seafood-gluten free, and it was sooo tastey. Even the pineapple chunks were cut from fresh pineapple.
I got the Ninja Tuna Roll and a brown rice veggie bowl. Talk about fresh spicy tuna roll with more fresh  tuna sliced on top. Best tuna Roll I've ever eaten. There's something beautiful about brown rice topped with perfectly stir fried Fresh veggies, and this place was on point! 

The menu is large enough to satisfy a wide range of taste buds!
The food is alright. You order right when you walk in at the register. They serve the sushi on paper plates and their prices are the same as real sushi restaurants. Disappointing.

This was my first time here. I had noticed this place when going to 5 guys burger and fries. They have menus on the outside of the restaurant so you can just grab one and go. The menu is really simple offering many different types of sushi rolls and "jumping rice" aka fried rice. 

I had decided to get some to go for the familia - I got the pineapple fried rice (thai style), dynamite rice, and teriyaki chicken over white rice. The pineapple fried rice was alright - it lacked alot of flavor and something was just missing. After a couple bites, the boyfriend and I decided to pass it on to my dad..haha My dad had gotten the dynamite rice - this is basically the dynamite roll over more white rice. My dad said it was overly cheesy and he needed to drink alot of beer to help wash it down. I had gotten the teriyaki chicken, and it wasn't anything special. It was literally just some grilled chicken over white rice - $9 is a little too steep for something so simple. The portions were big and the service was great, but we weren't too impressed with the food. 

Next time, I plan on getting the kimchi jumping rice and some of their rolls. It's korean owned ( you can tell the moment you walk into the restaurant ) so i'm thinking the kimchi fried rice and rolls should be good for next time. The boyfriend and I plan on trying this place one more time before we decide to not come back!

Came in after a gym workout, I was craving for some teriyaki chicken. But as I was reading the menu, something caught my attention. It was a rice bowl entree called the "Fishing Bowl" was described to have tuna, super white tuna, salmon, albacore, red snapper, tamago, and sweet shrimp with sushi rice. The description made my mouth water. It was basically a sushi lovers dream all in one bowl!!!! The price was about $18 and some change. 

When I ordered, the cashier asked if it was to go or to dine in. I replied that we were going to dine in. We sat anywhere we wanted. The tables and chairs were modern and so was atmosphere.

The wait for the food took about 15-20 min. Which was a little long for something simple to make, considering everything is raw sashimi. But as I received my bowl. It was worth the wait! The cuts were 3 ounces and 2-3 of every type of fish. The quality was better than I thought. It tasted fresh as you would get from a sushi bar. 

Overall: (scale 1-5)

Customer Service: 4.5
Food: 5
Price: 4.5 
Restaurant dining: 5

I have only tried this bowl. But I'll be sure to come back for the other items!

Food is 5/5. Delicious food with decent price. You can dine inside but there will be no servers as the dine area is self-service.

Im slashing a star because food ordered "for here" will be served to you with paper plates and plastic disposable containers. Not too appetizing especially for the kind of food they serve.

Ambiance is ok, minimalist style which deserves food servers. But having food servers might inflate their prices.
I are here yesterday and had to come back today .. It's yummy healthy fresh food ! The place is super clean and the people are very helpful and nice .. It will be one of my favorites now .

This review is based upon my first experience.  

Originally,  I was looking for a place that serve bibimbaap,  but found out that K-Bop closed, which lead me to here.  I was very upset that I had to substitute my craving for something else other than bibimbaap.  

So,  I went in and found out you order at the counter first before you sit yourself.   Server "A" asked if it's my first time,  I told her yes.  I ordered a teriyaki bowl,  baked mussels,  and water.  I sat down and received a small appetizer sample, which was good.  I then received my mussels,  which was made with kewpie mayo, which was delicious.  Then came the teriyaki bowl...

So,  the teriyaki bowl was drowned in teriyaki sauce! Drowned I tell you!  The teriyaki steak had its own swimming pool of teriyaki sauce!   As an Asian,  you don't drown your rice in teriyaki sauce ... Actually,  you don't drown your rice,  period!  So,  I took a few bites and couldn't eat it anymore.  

I asked server "B" if I could have a container and a side of rice to go because I didn't like the drowned rice. She tells me this: "Next time tell us to put the sauce on the side."  ( haah?) I told her I did not know because it's my first time.  Then she says "ok. I do this one time for you."  It really didn't sound all that mean, but a bit on the rude side.  

Anyways,  I will go back and adjust my review as needed. It deserves another shot.

Been here twice so far.  Food is pretty good and service is quick and friendly.  Definitely a nice place if you're in the mood for some good Asian food.  Can get a bit pricey unless you know what you're getting, but worth it.

This hidden gem has fresh fish that can easily go toe-to-toe with a more fancy restaurant.   With a nice mix of cooked rice, sushi, Korean, Thai and Japanese, there's certainly a flavor to appeal to all palettes.   

The restaurant is unassuming with it's decor and the order-at-the-counter motif, but the real joy is in the flavorful food that is made fresh to order and delivered with a smile.  

Make sure you try the rolley rice bowl or the salmon blossom.  Fantastic treats and not too spivey.  The Thai pineapple rice is a good choice for hot food.  

The menu is full of options, with lots of repeat visits in store for the future.

11-16-17
Walked in, greeted right away very friendly staff. Their menu is great there's variety and the food seemed amazing until we got our food. We dined in and receive our food in styrofoam plates and plastic containers. There was an employee sitting next to us eating in a nice bowl and was just confused really. We got the lunch special so it came with miso soup and salad that were also in plastic containers. The soup was less than halfway filled in the cup wtf? I ordered a chicken cutlet bowl that was $9 and is the lowest quality food I've ever eaten for the price that it is. The portioning is good but quality isn't there. I 15/10 don't recommend this place. The employees were also arguing about workplace drama that was very good entertainment. Go to other Asian joints the price would be the same or lower with much better quality. Big disappointment and I wish success for the business.

I am sure there are a lot of things to get here but I get one thing.

Crab Jumping Rice with Thin Noodles and No Onions.

The service is quick, pleasant, and the atmosphere is clean.

I've never had a problem here and it's now my go to place when I feel like crab.

Thanks for keeping me away from AYCE sushi and giving me my Crab fix!
Perfect place for quick sushi but still high quality. Great veggie roll and surprisingly good salmon nigiri.

This place used to be one of my go to spots for a quick and cheap lunch. Let me start off by saying that their portions are amazing!!! I started coming here last year and I have never been disappointed. They have a good amount of sushi rolls and a variety of bowls and rice plates. When you walk in you order at the counter and they bring the food to your table when it is ready. It isn't too busy and the food doesn't take long to cook. My personal favorite is the chicken jumping rice. If you go during lunch I believe it comes with miso soup or salad (but that could've changed). They have other options such as steak and shrimp. The jumping rice is essentially fried rice with your choice of meat. It has amazing flavor and they give you a lot! So you better be ready to carb up and hit leg day! I also tried their Teri chicken bowl and they are generous with the chicken! If you're on a diet try their sashimi salad. It's amazing! The sashimi tastes fresh and they give you nice cuts. Your price range at this location varies from $7-$15. The staff is friendly and it's clean! Give this place a try if you're lookin for a quick lunch or dinner!
Love having new places to eat. Food was good. Service was fast and helpful.  A bit overprice. Overall - a good experience.

Been coming here for a few years now so this review is overdue! I've tried a few items from their menu and in my opinion, you can't go wrong with any dish here. My go-to is the Jumping Crab with thick noodles, Snow White roll, and garlic edamame. This isn't an AYCE place but they're rolls are pretty average price compared to other places though. If you're looking for a quick sushi place to satisfy your taste buds, give this place a try!
This was 'Jackpot' find in Las Vegas. eat in or take out your cant lose! Healthy Asian cuisine with a huge variety of dishes. I love this place. Id love to Franchise this in California!!!

This is one of my favorite fast service restaurants in the area. The food is consistently delicious and fresh, the staff is always friendly!  I highly recommend the Kim Chee soba with pork!!! Yum yum!!!
I had the Poke.  It was fresh and very flavorful. Good size portion. Great service, they bring it to your table with all the side stuff.
Food is amazing! Sushi rolls are fresh! Didn't take long at all. Definitely coming back

This place is pretty good for a "order at the counter and sit down until your food comes out" kinda sushi place. I'm used to only going to AYCE joints but I thought I'd give this place a shot since it's so close to my apartment.

My roomie and I walk in about 5pm. Not too many people in here. Ambiance is casual. The decor inside is really nice. And we were greeted with a friendly smile who was happy to wait while we looked at the menu.

I ordered a cucumber crush roll, a tuna tango roll, and of course the screaming O. I forgot what my roomie ordered lol. Fish was very fresh! And we both devoured our meals. My three rolls and regular drink came out to be $30 and some odd change whereas, at most AYCE joints, $30 more or less gets you unlimited (loosely put) amounts of food! But I mean, hey, it was worth a shot coming here.

Will be back for the rice dishes and noodles! They look sooooo yummy.

Quick and good! It's like aloha kitchen. You order at the register and then sit down and wait for your food.

I ordered the mixed poki salad. It came with both salmon and tuna for a reasonable portion. The fish was fresh and tastes great! I didn't like how salty it was but the wasabi helped balance it. 

My man ordered the beef teriyaki and that was pretty good too. they give you the option either brown rice or white! 

Be back soon!

Great food and great customer service ; the guy who works there was very helpful and informative about the menu and their food items. He recommended the Crispy Chicken Mayo Bowl and WOW. it looked and tasted 100/100. We got some rolls as well like the Crispy Dragon, Shrimp Tornado roll, and the Spicy Monster. They were good and the sauces taste good too.
Great fresh food.  It reminds me if a fast food sushi spot.  The ninja roll & super mix were deelish!

Casual, but quality. The staff always made sure we were ok and even gave us free drinks because our order took long, which we were surprised because it wasn't that bad especially considering they make their sushi fresh on order. Their prices are average sushi prices for non AYCE. That's expected, but their sushi size is respectable and in good portion. If you want that quick fix without the whole fancy and too many people  and waiting this place is a go. Also you must try their jumping crab fried rice. Outstanding & Delicious. I'm coming back.

My friend & I stopped in for lunch, she ordered the teriyaki salmon, I ordered the basil brown rice bowl. With shasito peppers on the side
 The portions were okay, the food came out timely, hot and we enjoyed it. No complaints

Jumping rice is always a good spot when you live around the southwest and is craving for some bomb fried rice. Spicy basil with angus beef is a good choice. Soft shell crab is good too if u want seafood. Their shrimp tempura is super good and crispy but it only comes in 3 pieces which is a bummer.  Prices I think are a bit expensive on certain items and being a take out spot but the containers used for take out is definitely good enough to share for 2 people.
Food are amazing. I've been here several times & ordered different entrees & all have been delicious. Staff & service are efficient.

Love the creativity of this place. I love their locations because it's closer to where I work. I like the area because it's very new. The service was good and friendly. Food came right on time, not too late but just right! I'll be visiting this place soon!

Fast food sushi joint. They have riceless rolls which is probably the only thing that has my attention. Pretty pricey for what it is. 

Nothing else amazing to say about this spot.

First time here I usually stay away from fast food ESP Asian fast food but surprisingly it was great. The sushi rolls were super yummy comparable to I love sushi but less expensive & so was the spicy chicken bowl with jasmin rice. I'll def be coming back.

After finding shrimp in my veggie tempura I ended up throwing everything away because I'm sure there is cross contamination with everything they prepare. I'm allergic to shellfish so that's a big no for me. Won't ever go back to this place

Talk about some FRIED RICE action!!! I had this place bookmarked for sometime now and wish never took me this long too check Jumping Rice & Rolls out. At first thinking about the name sounds rather corny or catchy so had no expectations. What I did find was reasonable price korean/japanese food for lunch. Interior design that really nice really modern (reminded me little bit of Yonaka) look not just plain walls and feel like in more upscale restaurant. The menu is pretty straight forward with your standard sushi rolls, nigiri, sides/appetizers. The star of the show for me was the jumping rice section. Maybe jumping for the spicy level not that all of them are spicy. Each one comes with your selection of protein for the Indonesia Jumping Rice had choice of chicken, shrimp, or think beef was the third option. I opted for the chicken. I wanted too try more of the menu since it was my first time went with Calamari Tempura. 

The Calamari Tempura was awesome. The thing stood out most is the calamari was not  ring cuts of squid but nice whole piece not thin either. So the inside was nothing but calamari bliss. You had the tempura batter that was so on point. It was flaky, nice even coating all around, and most of all not greasy. On the inside nice thicker cut of calamari cooked perfect, lightly seasoned, and moist. Dipping sauce brought it all together. Great first course.

I had the Indonesia Jumping Rice. Forgot too mention not only protein get choice of rice from white, jasmine, or brown rice. Jumping Rice & Rolls does have some healthy options on the menu. The rice I was surprise at the portion size.  I thought was good size. You added the protein again nice size portion talk about full lunch. Yay!  

No doubt plan on coming back trying more of the Jumping Rice section. Kim Chee fried rice is my favorite kind and few more fried rices that want too try. The sushi not sure about but the pictures looking good. No doubt for me it all about the fried rice next visit and probably the next one and so forth. Not many places I can think of serve good fried rice more less here you have options. It affordable price and nice atmosphere kick back enjoy your meal. The service is awesome friendly, helpful, and check on you make sure things are going well.
The crab jumping rice is AMAZING! Added just a little spice (level 3). Highly recommend you give them a try.
This was an amazing experience ...great food. Quick service. If you are a fan of Vietnamese fried rice or fried rice in general - this is an awesome place. Very flavorful
Great place to grab a quick bite to eat . Many options on the menu from rice bowls to sushi rolls.

Nice little find off the strip, very close to Red Rock Resort / 215 freeway. Our friends introduced us to this restaurant, which offers a quick service menu of sushi, rice/noodle bowl, stir fry plates. We tried the spicy tuna roll, spicy basil jumping rice chicken bowl (with brown rice), and the teriyaki chicken bowl. The food was great, I liked how they had shredded veggies in the rice bowl instead of large chunks. Before your meal comes out they bring you a small cup of a pickled onion/jalape√±o mix, and a corn slaw (?) . . . both things were good, but seemed a bit out of place, I thought for a moment I was getting Korean BBQ haha.

Docking one star for them being out of rice noodles (especially since it's an option in half their dishes).
First find on the Yelp app.  My friend and I tried it, and keep going back.  I think she is obsessed with their food.  She made it her mission to try everything on the menu.

Ok, I gave it another try because I needed something fast and easy. It appears to me as though they have lowered they're sushi prices and revamped their menu :) I got the spicy monster for $9 and it was really good! I also got the classic jumping rice and for $7 with chicken, it was a big portion and very fresh. I'm happy I gave it another try. good job listening to your customers!!
This has got to be one of the best fried rice places ive ever tried ive been all around the USA but this is hands down thee best
Seriously best fried rice I've ever had and the sushi was delicious definitely wasn't expecting it to be as good as it was, will be back again

The owner is very sweet and welcoming. The first time I came there I had no idea what this place was, I just got a menu with coupons in my business mailbox so decided to come on in. The owner asked if it was my first time and broke down the menu to me. I got my drink for free and was stuffed on my order. The lunch specials come with their tasty salad and miso soup. Mmmmmmmm miso soup. I had some type of spicy fried rice and it was loaded with flavor and fresh ingredients! 
Love this place! And it's always clean and fast!

Love love love this place! Great balance of casual dining with an upscale feel.
Menu is amaze! Quality of the food is great and the prices are mind blowing.
Definitely competes with Strip/Asia Town restaurants and MUCH cleaner!!!!!!
Also has beer/wine.

I've never had sushi served to me on a paper plate before, but it's not bad. This place was eerily quiet, but it was good for a nice lunch with my son.
Very clean inside with nice decor. We tried a tuna roll, a salmon roll, and a California roll. Not bad...a little bland. Maybe it's the quality of fish. Still, I'd come here again if i were in the area. $3 Sapporo was an incentive for me haha.
Good sushi and lots of choices at affordable prices. Kim Chee fried rice is the best! Clean environment

I've always driven by this place and honestly never looked twice but earlier tonight I was searching for nearby places to eat & I figured I'd give it a try. 

It's super cute on the inside and the decor makes it comfy. The food came out within 10 minutes of ordering and it tasted as delicious as it looks in pictures. I would recommend this place for the convenience, quality, and price.

I've only gone there once so far for take out and the quality of the food is pretty good. I ordered a chicken teriyaki bowl with veggies. It was better than teriyaki madness, yogi's, and samurai sam. They give you lots of meat and the chicken wasn't dry at all. (Teriyaki madness always gets your white meat over cooked)
I haven't tried any of their rolls or jumping rice dishes but from what I saw at the tables, it looks really good. My friend ordered the spicy basil jumping rice and he said it was yummy. Try this place out of you're tired of going to samurai sam and all the other teriyaki places.

2 stars because of service. When you walk in you have to order before you sit down. I was floored, cashiers attitude was mind boggling.. I asked if they had crispy rice spicy tuna and she smirked and responded "NO" didn't make eye contact and seemed to be bothered by my question.. The remainder of the transaction was very rude dry responses and super unwelcoming attitude.. At this point I'm very uncomfortable and confused.. Why would they hire someone who is so unprofessional..? Funny thing is I tipped her hoping it would kinda make her less aggressive however as she handed my receipt she was already looking at the customers behind me to take their order... Wow I've never felt so non existent. On the positive note food was great high quality meat and great portions!

My new dinner take out destination!!! Love their specialty rolls and fried rice! Crab jumping rice is my favorite! Love how they make our daughter's mini chicken jumping rice without any seasoning per request and with fresh ingredients only for $5! :)

Found this place on yelp and decided to go give it try.  I ordered the crab fried rice and it was delicious!  There were real crab meat in the rice and a soft shell crab on the top....everything was cooked perfect.  My friend ordered a pork cutlet cause she's allergic to seafood and she enjoyed her meal as well.

If your looking for the perfect to go sushi spot, look no further! The sashimi salad is amazing, the cucumber island roll and the Alaskan roll never disappoint. Miso is always a staple, and the cucumber salad is always fresh. The spider roll is definitely my favorite!

This is my first time trying out here. The place and decorations are pretty cool. People working here are pretty nice too. I ordered the Poki Salad, Thai Pineapple Jumping Rice, and Shrimp Tornado Rolls, all of these stuff are so good, especially the rolls. I loved it! All of their stuff have big portions which is good to share to someone! I guess I'll be here frequently. I'm glad I found this place

They have a decent priced lunch special here- I ordered the chicken jumping rice (its fried rice, nothing especially pops out about it) with house salad and miso soup for $7. 

The location is good, the establishment is clean and the decor and menu are particularly interesting, but I'm a little disappointed that the signature rice was decent at best. I had to throw down some serious sriracha to get the party goin.

I'll still give Jumping another try, perhaps one of the bowls or rolls next. Until next time...

This review is going off of a one time visit on a Thursday afternoon, shortly after they opened. I never heard of this place until my sister-in-law told me about it. She said she loved their fried rice, so to be safe, it was the only thing I tried. 

She got the crab fried rice and I got the pork belly fried rice. The pork belly in jasmine rice was really good, I only wish it was crispy for texture, but the flavor was on point. I don't like crab much, so I was not too fond of the crab pieces in her rice.

A bonus is that they have refillable fountain drinks!

I don't think I would be down to try any of their sushi rolls, not because I don't think they're good, but I would just much rather have AYCE, which isn't an option here.

That atmosphere at this location is really great - nice, clean, fresh! I'll have to come back.

Absolutely love this place! I was recommended by a friend to try this place out for quite some time. Walk in and the atmosphere was great. Ordered the Crispy Chicken Mayo Bowl and it was excellent!! Will definitely make this place a go to lunch spot.

Love the food, but dislike customer service. I was in the middle of ordering and the phone rang. The employee told me to to "hold on", answered the phone, and proceeded to take the phone order. Enough time went by where I sat back down to wait until she was done. We drove some distance to get dinner, so it was disappointing to be treated like that.

Got home and realized they forgot the teriyaki sauce for the chicken and beef plates. Not happy.

Best best best in Vegas. The screaming Oh salad is one of the best I've had. Brought lots of people and they all love it. Atmosphere is great for dine in. A must in Summerlin area, worth the drive from the strip.

Wondering where to go on this side on town and this was a complete guess. I've seen this place to be open for a while now and a few of my friends have suggested it. Didn't realize how large the place is while maintaining that cozy / modern appearance. Getting to the food... Not imitation ingredients, good size portions and the flavor is awesome! Will definitely come back again.

Underestimated spot in town. They have great food and it's really fresh. The service is decent and quick. I've never heard of the rice bowls that they have but the descriptions on the menu are perfect, and what I got was what I expected.  I'll definitely continue to dine here.

The food here is quick and delicious! Their fried items, such as the katsu and mayo chicken are crispy while retaining their moisture. The mayo chicken was especially good; although they put a lot of mayonnaise it isn't overwhelming and it balances well with the chicken and egg. Their white rice is also pretty fluffy. Portion wise, you could probably split it between two people for a lighter lunch. 

The salmon skin salad was pretty good, but different from most places I've been to. Instead of being on a bed of seaweed, it's just normal iceberg salad. The dressing was tasty though and the skin was cooked well. 

Also, service was fast even at lunchtime and the tables were clean. The interior is colorful and the seats are comfy, so overall a really great place. 

TLDR; big and delicious rice bowls served quickly and will leave you craving for more fried chicken
Absolutely delicious!  Especially if you like eel sauce which my son does. He ordered 4 rolls!! Very very good. Would stop by again! And again!
The food is really good and the service is on point. I haven't tried the sushi yet but that will be my next visit.
Good concept, good location, good service...but the fish is of the AYCE/supermarket variety and overpriced. Big thick cuts of rubbery fish...no thanks

i usually order my lunch here,beef fried rice less oil.its usually pretty good.but last time,i still ordered the same thing. and they gave me a super oily fried rice ever...i was upset....and today i tried one more time,not thing change!!! Super oily fried rice!!! so terrible!! i think because the new lady at the front desk she not good in english and didnt remember what customer order!!!i will never come back!!!
They are a little more expensive but the rolls are a good size. The jumping rice was enough to share. Take out is a plus.
Cute little spot. A little pricey for the environment and some of the food quality but overall very good and some of the items is so worth the price because you get such big portions too! Very good

Surprisingly good!  We live in the area and kept seeing the name of this place.  Wasn't exactly sure what 'jumping rice' was, so we always drove by it.  Then we got a menu in one of the local papers and saw all the great menu items so we decided to have lunch there the other day.  Very clean, modern and peaceful decor.
We were happy to see the brown rice option, so we ordered the Jumping Rice (basically fried rice), with beef, and you can add extra meat for another $2 and make a fairly healthy protein packed meal.  There were lots of egg and veggie bits, and very flavorful.  Generous portion as well.  They also gave a miniscule free sample of their corn salad, and OMG!!!!  Soooooo good.  Have to get that next time.  Friendly and quick service.  We will definitely be going back!

I work in the their shopping center and I come for lunch at least once a week. The food is always delicious, they make it fast, which is great when I'm on my lunch break. I love the jumping noodle bowls. They always are polite and warm when you walk in. Very important to me, the restaurant is always clean! I love this place.

The food here is average. Not good, not bad. I would not wake up in the middle of the night craving their food. But I might come back if I have no other place to go. Although their seaweed salad is good.
Portions are big and the food was alright but I definitely got really sick when I got home. I think I got food poisoning. I can barely drink water.

Small portions. Food is served in plastic Togo containers..   wish the sushi rolls were more affordable..  The food has good taste..I personally got the angus steak teriyaki plate and the jumping noodle with shrimp.. The shrimp was cut up and very dry, not satisfy my shrimp craving!!  Angus steak on my plate was delishes and cooked just right, but also really small serving..

My review:  Food was fresh and fast and service was great.  Easy and casual, order and sit. Nothing too original. Rice and rolls as name suggests, but also noodles. 

His review:  The noodles are REALLY good. I loved them. We had beef. Also, the bathrooms are really clean and not just for an Asian place!
Love this place! Good & decent price. All the girls that work here are really nice also.

The food here is definitely 5 stars for the price point. Very affordable, healthier than most restaurants and absolutely delicious!! I've tried most things on the menu but I always have to get the jumping rice extra extra spicy  Only problem I've encountered twice was concerning the service. Poor girl at the cashier box seemed to be completely inebriated but she might have just been exhausted or something but either way, 20 minutes just to place your order then another 30 to get your food is a little much for a semi fast food joint. Still an awesome place and I'll probably stop by tonight. Honestly this place deserves 4 3/4 stars haha.

This place is great! I'm a picky sushi eater and this place is good! You'd never think that from a little take-out place. I really like to order on their website. You can pay there and they'll have it ready for you. Super easy!

It was quiet when I walked in.  Just a family dining.  Well I was debating between a rolled ice cream late dessert lunch next door, or this place.  Went for real food.  Ordered the Indonesian chicken and rice.  Spicy-licious!!!  Gotta have lotsa tissue handy cuz you'll be multi-tasking while eating.  

It was goooood!  Even better cuz the lunch special came with soup amd salad, with crunchy lettuce.  I hate when restaurants serve wilted lettuce.  Not this place.  And I was able to bring the rest of my rice home for dindinz!  I love when meal orders can serve two or more!

Nice woodwork wall in the back where the TV is.  It's clean and well kept.  You order once stepping in amd they bring your food out to you.  Comfy seating against the walls.  Nice lighting.  Giant spoon and fork on the back walls.  I lile this place.

Amazing! I got the sashimi salad, it did not disappoint. The fish was fresh and nice thick pieces. I also got the tuna roll and it had a great flavor. I will have to come back because they have a huge menu... I need to try more!

The menu is actually surprisingly big for the price.  Most things are around the $10 range which is fair for lunch.  The quality is above par for an establishment such as this that looks more like a fast food place than a quality eats.  They also sell beer and wine for your alcoholic needs.

I went with the beef terriyaki bowl.  It was filling, marinated well, and tasty.  It came with a side of corn (don't know why) which was nonetheless tasty and a great appetizer for my lunch.  You could easily make this bowl worth a meal and a half and take it home if you choose.

I will be back here to try out the rest of the menu.  If all entrees are as well priced, tasty, and large as my bowl, I think this could be a go-to spot for a mid-week meal.

This is a nice little secret local spot nestled into the same parking lot as FIVE GUYS, SWEET TOMATOES, and CHRONIC TACOS, off of Flamingo & the 215 freeway (opposite side of the freeway from the large shopping center with LVAC)- The quality of the food is fantastic considering EVERYTHING on their menu is under $10!!  

On top of being a cheap, good quality, FAST lunch spot, the atmosphere inside feels as though you're at a nice sushi restaurant. 

One of my favorite aspects of coming to Jumping Rice are their sauces. Some sushi establishments have very MEH sauces in comparison to here. The SCREAMING O' sauce is absolutely DIVINE!! Even when ordered on the side and used as a dipping sauce for tempura or sushi rolls. 

If you haven't tried JUMPING RICE, you're missing out! ?
So I've been trying more and more Sushi and I found this place that was super yummy there rice is amazing the roles were super yummy and they have Sapporo beer all in all a  win
I love their soft shell crab jumping rice and the tornado sushi!! A great place to get fast Japanese food.

As far as customer service goes, this place is lacking. My boyfriend and I came here to try something new and upon entering, the girl at the register stared at us. It was uncomfortable and awkward, so finally after about 2 minutes of uncomfortable silence and her simply staring a hole in our foreheads, my boyfriend said hello, to which she replied, "Hello, we close in 1 hour." OKAY THANKS GEEZ WOW.

We ordered our food and sat down. As we looked around we realized there was no one else here. It was empty. Was it because of their lacking customer service and common manners? Was it because they close in an hour? Or was it because their food wasn't that great? The world may never know. It took awhile for our food to come which was weird since we were literally the only ones eating there the whole time and we ordered 2 small plates.

The food here was mediocre at best. Would I recommend to a friend that they eat here? Probably not. Nothing really stuck out but the girl who made us feel uncomfortable.

As we were leaving, it took us by surprise to see the girl and, I assume the chef/cook, behind the counter. The girl, sitting in a chair texting, and the chef man crouched down behind the counter, also texting. Hmmm.. Okay. Maybe their texts were more important than our food.
Solid portion of food for the price, but the taste is not very authentic. Tasty nonetheless for fast Asian takeout rice.

Service is THE BEST they remember every detail and they were friendly...Food was well presented, well cooked & taste fresh. They wide variety selection to choose from & ladies up front are very knowledgeable, they were helpful and gave us options for our dietary needs!!! Thumbs up!

This place is supposed to be a fusion of asian american food.  However, much to my surprise, their shrimp fried rice  was very authentic - believe it or not, better than many places in Chinatown.  Their baked mussels were extraordinary.  Who would think that such a simple/casual place would have such special dishes.

All the food in this gem of a restaurant is fresh. Try what appeals to you...sashimi, miso, tempura...you will not be disappointed. The staff is efficient and professional. And, the food is fabulous, from the Cucumber Crush to the Crispy Chicken Mayo Bowl to the Dynamite Bowl. Eat in or take out.

I love this place! The concept,  execution,  & most importantly food are great. 

When I recommend this place to friends(which I do frequently) I describe it as Asian Fast Food. That description doesn't really do it justice. It's more of a Japanese Steakhouse,  Thai, Chinese restaurant fusion. You order at the cashier as you walk in.  The food comes out promptly.  The sashimi salad (my favorite) is flavorful and filling. 

They have a huge menu. This is my go to  for a quick bite instead of actual fast food joints.

This only thing wrong with this place is the name. Jumping Rice and Rolls..why? I had driven by this place many times, and honestly the reason I didn't go in was because it gave me the impression of a place with too much carbs. I went in for lunch because a friend suggested it and didn't want to say no. I'm glad to say I was blown away!! The servers are really accommodating. You can tell the quality of the food is high and the price is low. Nothing on their menu is over $9 and their lunch specials are $7. They have sushi although I didn't not have the sushi. Absolutely the best fried rice in Vegas. They make it fresh and give you the option of white or brown rice, the cucumber salad was delicious and topped with crab flakes. I assumed it was imitation crab and when I asked I was surprised when the server said it was real crab. I'm looking forward to experimenting more of their menu.

Great food and service. Try the Volcano, sounds spicy but its not, it's actually a bit sweet with great flavor. Rainbow roll tastes good as well. I loved the rice. Don't remember the name of it but it had small meat bits in it....delicious. menu can be found at their Web page:

http://www.jumpingriceandrolls.com

Pretty good! Not a fancy place and I would not go out of my way to come here but it was pretty good. It was pretty cheap as well! I got a lot of food with my order and my friends and I were very satisfied!

My boss ordered in lunch for the whole team from here. The online purchasing via their website was flawless. They made everything exactly as ordered and had the food ready at the scheduled time. Walking into the restaurant to pick up the food was lovely. The dining area was very clean and the wood made it feel very comfortable. 

We ordered sushi, vegetable bowls, crab bowls, soups, salad, and chicken. Everything was made very well and they also included sauces that really elevated the dishes! We really enjoyed our team lunch, and will be eating here again!

It's alright. Nothing really special but good cheap sushi for a work night if you want a quick takeout. They have good selection rolls and fried rice. These are large portions though ans can easily be shared by two pr may be three people.

I have been coming here for a few years now and l live it but l notice a few months ago they reduce the portions of the food.
Still worth it and l love the food here.

This place has closed and they are putting something new l guess.!
My wife brought home some take out from this place. Fish was fresh. Sushi rolls were excellent. This review is only based on the good I had.

This is a nice place for lunch. I got the rollercoaster sushi and lunch special jumping shrimp rice. Food is well seasoned. The miso soup is really really good. Service is friendly and prices are affordable.

I usually will not eat at any other place that has sushi besides Kanji steak house.......but I am glad I tried it! I had the ahi poke salad which I absolutely loved. Usually it can taste over oceany but this was perfect. I also had the shrimp tempura and that was good as well. I had the chicken teriyaki bowl with jasmine rice and that was good as well. Prices were good and service was as well. Cute small spot and You order and pay before you sit. They have plates to noodles to sushi and raw fish. Really good!!

A friend kept telling me that I had to try this place that it was a place I'd really like.  On the way home from Henderson, this was an easy off the 215 and I decided to give it a try.

You order at the counter and a server brings your food when it's ready.  You also get a cup for iced tea and you serve yourself.  The sign out front said 7 days a week lunch specials but I didn't find anything especially appealing nor of good value.  I don't order sushi at places like this.  I prefer nigiri to rolls.  I ordered their crispy chicken mayo bowl with jasmine rice (you have a choice of white, brown, or jasmine rice.)  The rice comes with deep fried chicken, shredded egg, mayo, and sweet soy sauce.

While waiting, I got my iced tea.  I found it strange the cashier didn't know if they had unsweetened tea.  They actually have one of the 4 variety pick of iced teas next to their Coke machine.

In a short time, a runner brought my chicken mayo bowl.  The chicken was crispy and the squeezed mayo gave it a good taste.  My favorite part was the egg in the rice.

The meal was OK--something different--but I don't see myself returning here except to try one other bowl that's listed as spicy.  maybe I can get them to up their spice level when I go.  The place is worth a try!
Delicious, the food was so fresh and the prices are great! Compared to these money greedy sushi places this place is the next spot to be in our foodie rotation!!
Yum yum yum great prices clean great location. All around amazing. Teriyaki bowl great and the crispy chicken with the mayo on it is so amazing. Would rather go here the benihanas.

Couple of years later and still this place hits the spot. Decided to pop in since I haven't been in awhile and ordered the salmon Blossom roll. Ofcourse it's still just as awesome as I remember it. Maybe even better. Either it's just been a long time or they're more generous with their servings and rice to fish ratio. Either way, I'm happy that they're still up and running and doing well. 

Oh! And now there's a brown rice substitute option! :)

I work right next door to this place and I absolutely love it! The first time I came here the workers were really nice and friendly and gave me and my boss from Lili Boutique next door free drinks! delicious food for a great price I love eating lunch here
Love the Shrimp Tornado Roll here and they always make it with soy paper for me. Their food is great!!!
I love this place!! I always get the Screaming O Salad. Is so fresh and delicious!! They have lunch specials everyday which is awesome!!!

I'm gonna hop off of this food train and tell you something about food. This is my moms favorite place she loves that cutlet bowl with a spicy tuna hand roll. But they charge you $7 for a hand roll. I can take $7 and go to sushi mon or Naka and get 2 hand rolls for that price. I'm not much a stickler but cmon. 

Let's get to it then. The food is pretty goood, chicken cutlet might be the best around this town. There rolls are pretty pricey, but it's how this place makes that mulla.
I like to get all up in this sushi and fill myself till I can't walk anymore. It's that good. Not a bad place to eat I give it a 4

Very good food.  Too pricy though.  They need to offer some lunch special options.  We spend $70 for enough food for 4 people.  The crab rice was awesome, but it's basically fried rice with crab - snow crab plus big chunks of what looks like soft shelled crab.  Very tasty and enough for a meal. Personally though I need more variety.  I guess you could go family style and share everything, but this is not where I would go for lunch for one or two.  The noodles are also tasty.  The sushi rolls are all ala carte priced so one roll is like $10 each. It's a good portion, but if you are hungry bring a wad of cash because it's not cheap.  The staff is really friendly and service is very quick.  I might go again and up this place one star, but for now I rank it A-OK 3 stars.  Oh and the poke salad is not really traditional poke it's like poke combined with seaweed salad.  Very good and worth the $10 based on the portion size.  

My only other comments concerns the format.  They have sushi bar quality sushi, but no sushi bar.  You order at the counter like fast food.  I would have expected lower prices for this type of service.  They bring your food to the table, but you order at the counter.  Also the name does not really explain what this place is all about.  I have great hopes for this place, but I sort of wonder if they are still working on the menu and dining format.  It has the feel of fast food, but the food is like what you get at a sit-down full service place.  Anyway it is good and worth a try.  Perhaps with some more visits I can hone in what I want from this place.
Wow! I am so impressed with this sort of "fast food" sushi place. The rolls and bowls were huge! Will be back.

My friends and I came here for a quick dinner. I wasn't expecting much, but boy was I wrong! This place is a hidden gem when it comes to quality asian food for cheap. Everything on the menu was pretty much less than 15 bucks. 
The Basil Spicy Jumping Rice was great! The shrimp was juicy, plump, and fresh. The rice was super flavorful and every bite was like a party in my mouth. Lol.
The Spicy Monster is pretty much what it is. If you enjoy your sushi swimming in spicy ponzu sauce, then you're in for a treat. Otherwise, stay clear because it is pretty hot. 
I would definitely come again, maybe to try out the bowls.

The customer service here is great! The two girls that helped me where so nice to me and my daughter. I ordered the dynamite bowl and it was amazing!!!!!! It's pretty much a deconstructed sushi roll with crab, mushrooms, and shrimp! I had the chef make it spicy and I'm glad I did because it was extra bomb!

I stopped here for lunch one day and I thought the fried rice was so delicious. I went during lunch time and ordered the Indonesia Jumping Rice which was a lil on the spicy side but not too spicy. The dish came with a side of salad and miso soup for their lunch special. It's such a great deal for $9.00. I came back with a couple friends and ordered the the Basil Jumping Rice. You can definitely taste the notes of the basil in the rice. The flavor was so good. My friends ordered the kimchi noodles, miso soup, and the spicy monster. If you really love the taste of kimchi, the kimchi noodles has a strong kimchi flavor. Personally, I thought it was pretty good. The spicy monster's sauce is a lil spicy but had that ponzu flavor. So delicious! It's crazy because the price is affordable and it's delicious!

I like this place!  I wanted to give this place a few tries before I reviewed it.  I've ordered to go several times since I live so close, I've gotten the spicy chicken thai fried rice and the screaming O salad.  The fried rice was filing and spicy, and I love the salad!  They serve the dressing on the side, and I usually drench my salad in the spicy, tangy dressing, so good!  I've also dined in a few times and tried several different rolls.  The rolls are pretty filling so I go here when I have a sushi craving but don't want to do all you can eat.  They don't do any Nigiri so as long as you're in the mood for either rice or rolls, this place will do.  I also like that they have sweetened iced green tea!  Every time I've come in, there isn't usually many people, the service is quick, the cashiers are always friendly, and the food is good.  *I've noticed the spicy rolls are sometimes inconsistent with spiciness though, either way, still so good!

Really can't say anything bad about this place. It was a spur of the moment decision to try them out. The staff member who greeted us, a young girl with black hair braided to the side (I can't remember her name), was very friendly. She could tell that my boyfriend and I were first time guests. She was very knowledgeable in regards to the menu and was able to tell us what came in each combo and what the local favorites were. 

My boyfriend chose the Basil Spicy Jumping Rice and I chose the Thai Pineapple Jumping Rice. We both substituted the white rice for brown and it was delicious. There was more than enough food for us both and it was seasoned well. Both bowls were made to order so it was fresh. The price of the bowls are about $9 each, which is about what you would pay for a bowl that size of fried rice. Parking was fair, nothing special. I would definitely recommend if you're looking for a healthy inexpensive made to order meal.

Great place that is not to far from home.  Sushi rolls are at a great prove and made fresh. We did our fresh test and changed up ingredients.  Dynamite bowl, spider roll,  and crab jumping noodles were great. .. must try.

I find myself in total agreement with Mai on this one. 

It's a great atmosphere, but basically, it's Americanized Korean food. 

My Korean wife ordered the Kim Chie Rice with Pork. One of the girls looked at her and asked her, "Have you ever had Kim Chie before."  That was a bad omen.

My wife and I agreed that you could not taste the Kim Chie in the food. It tasted decent, and that is why we give it 3 stars. 

Bottom line: Good for a take out or quick lunch, but someone has to pay for the expensive remodel, and it is the Customers. It is very overpriced compare to other Korean places that offer better food.

I came to jumping rolls and rice today for the first time and had a really great experience. I will admit I was not expecting much due to the cheesy name. However, I was pleasantly surprised. The service is top notch. Very attentive and helpful servers. The ambience is casual but tasteful. Prices are reasonable, and I think I will be coming back for to go orders in the future. Take out seems to be the focus. I am pregnant, so I was not able to order any raw sushi, but the shrimp tempura roll, seaweed salad, and the miso soup were all good. Not the best I've ever had, but well above average and definitely worth the price.
Excellent quality flavor .. Miso soup could b hotter .. Poki was amazing clean quiet would come back

I'm a regular here. The food is fantastic and the prices are very reasonable.  The children's menu are great too.  I must pick up orders of 2 teriyaki salmon bowls for children every other day.  They love it and my children have very discerning palettes.  If it's not good, they will not eat it.  All the rolls are delish!!!!

Asian sit down/take out spot off of the 215.

You order your food at the counter and there is limited seating if you want to dine in. The menu has an assortment of salads, rice dishes, and sushi rolls.

I had the spider roll, which had soft shell crab, and the Snow White roll. Both were very good. This is one of the better casual sushi spots in Vegas.
Ordered two rolls, miso, and a fried rice. Decent place if you want sushi for a cheap price. The fish was of good quality but the rolls were about average. Would consider coming back at another time.

I had a very pleasant dinner at this unassuming restaurant. I ordered the shrimp tornado and spicy salmon rolls. Both were fresh with excellent flavor. I found the woman working the register and running the food to the table to be friendly and attentive. When I told her how much I liked the sauce in the shrimp tornado roll, she offered me a side of it with my salmon roll. Very thoughtful. Will definitely go again when I am in the area.
Good food. Fast. Great choices. Too bad it's a small place because when it gets busy, I would hate to wait. The ladies at the front were very courteous and professional. Definitely going back!!
This is such a great place for takeout.  Fresh and good quality. Had the spicy basil combination thin noodles, shrimp tornado roll and house salad.  I come here every week for this.

AWSOME FOOD!!! I would recommend this to everyone who loves fresh and delicious sea food!! 
People here were nice. The place is casual. All their food looks yummy on pictures. Prices were reasonable. I got the DYNAMITE BOWL which has a taste that lives up to it's name!!! It was full of creamy, yummy seafood that I just love so so so so much!! My boyfriend had the Basil Spicy Jumping Rice.($12) which was good, a bit too spicy for my taste. We both agree that the dynamite bowl was waaaayy better. 

My only complaint is that it feels like a fast food restaurant. I think that with food THIS Great, it should have a better dining experience. 

I still give it a five star rating because I loved the food so much, I'm actually craving it right now. I just made myself hungry.. :(

I couldn't resist coming here to eat after I was running an errand in the same shopping center. I ordered the Rolley Rice Bowl. It was like a big sushi roll ! It tasted really fresh! I also ordered the calamari which was crunchy and plentiful.  When I first placed my order I didn't think it would be enough because I thought the portions would be small . It was more than enough to make me full. 

I ate my meal there solo. The atmosphere was peaceful and relaxing. The customer service was great ! I was checked on often to make sure I was doing okay and if I needed any refills.

I will looking for a lunch spot Friday July 11th and came across Jumping Rice and Rolls. It's fairly new and with that name I was curious what they had to offer. Well to my surprise (not really) they have various rice dishes  and sushi rolls. They were both tasty and well presented for a pretty casual place. The person behind the counter and the server were extremely polite and I will return. Nice casual atmosphere.. The roll was excellent!!

I didn't really know what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised!

I ordered the basil spicy jumping rice but wanted to have the marinated pork belly as the protein instead of the options listed on the menu. They were able to accommodate my request, and didn't charge extra, even though I was prepared to pay for off menu customizations.

Although we were dining in, the food came in a to-go container. I'm usually a bit "meh" about this, but I soon appreciated having the food already in a to-go container as I couldn't finish it.

The food itself was flavorful and, true to its name, spicy. I would definitely have this again.

I'm updating my review to 4 stars. I've been back a couple times and have had nothing but good experiences. I tried a rainbow now too and it was well executed.  The fish was fresh and roll was neatly done.

Went here for lunch the other day with my parents and it's definitely a go to hidden gem. 

You start by ordering up front and then sitting down and waiting for the food to come out to you. We ordered the mini chicken mayo bowl, Japanese lasagna roll and Snow White roll to split.

After waiting about five-ten minutes we received our food in huge portions and even a sample of the corn salad. After enjoying our meal we decided to order the tempera green tea ice cream for dessert as well. Delicious! 

Definitely a must try for great asian fusion food on the southwest side.

Got an order for take out late afternoon. It was my first time and I didn't really know the menu so I got a rolley bowl. Shrimp, crab, avocado. Very disappointed that the shrimp was an old piece of something and a thin slice of avocado. Probably won't be back.

I think I've found a new Asian spot! I've been wanting to try this place out since they opened and I finally got around to it. I didn't know what to expect, I was just anticipating good food! And I wasn't let down! This place is great! 

The quality of service was ok, but the quality of food made up for it. The gentleman who took our order wasn't too friendly or hospitable, definitely not the best look for when you first walk into the restaurant. He wasn't really helpful just let us stare at the menu for a while and then we finally ordered. 

We ordered four dishes and it came out to be less than $40 which was great because it was enough food for two! They had pictures of some of the items which helped a lot but also made it difficult to chose. 

It's order at the counter and seat yourself. We sat in the back corner and waited about 10 mins for our food, which wasn't a bad at all. The food came out on paper plates but I didn't mind because the presentation was still there and it was great food! 

I can't wait to come back and try more things! Definitely didn't let me down on the first time!

My friends and I have driven by this establishment a few times and finally decided to try it out for ourselves. It's a good choice if you're going with people who don't really like sushi. The rolls were nothing too special, but they did taste good! Jumping Rice are their fried rice dishes and I didn't try any of them, but I did try the Chicken Mayo bowl and that, I thought was both unique and worth the price! You've got nothing to lose here! It's a good lunch, the place is clean and the staff is friendly.
I liked this place for a quick sushi dinner. Walk in order pay and then they bring your food. Rolls are tasty and garlic edamame was fantastic. Will be back
Ordered the crab jumping rice, but substituted thin noodles.  It was excellent!  Highly recommend.

I was kind of excited to try this place as the pictures of the food look really tempting. However, my experience was just ok. We ordered the American jumping rice. This dish comes with hot dogs, I was really hoping for a better quality of sausage. The overall flavor was just ok. We also got the Screaming O salad. The pictures of this plate looked awesome, but again I was not that impressed. The tuna was fresh and the ponzu was a nice addition, but the dish was still lacking. And last but not least we decided to try one of the rolls. We ordered the Cucumber island. The cucumber roll was falling apart, but I have to admit that the fish selection was good.  Unfortunately, there was nothing memorable about this dish either. 
The restaurant atmosphere was nice and modern, I just wished it was not a counter service restaurant. Overall, the food was very average and forgettable.

Went here a few weeks ago and will not be coming back.  The staff was nice, but the food is less than mediocre. The kimchi fried rice was very greasy, and the shrimp tempura roll was rolled so loosely that the contents were pretty much falling out.  I don't get how this place is getting such high marks.

Pretty nice quick service sushi place. A little overpriced I would say compared to many great places in in china town. Not an AYCE so  don't go there too hungry.  We have tried the different versions of their fried rice and it wasn't all that impressive. Not bad but nothing special either. The sushi is really good. All in all a nice to go spot.

We came in here and it wasn't busy. The menu seems to offer a good variety. The cashiers were very friendly and nice. The only thing that was,...different was that they used paper plates. I was a little turned off by that. 
I've never had sushi on a paper plate before. This places isn't high end but they have good sushi rolls in my opinion. I'm sure that's how they cut costs, but I would just suggest that they use nice plates like other sushi restaurants.

Such a cute restaurant! The food is always on point. I enjoy their combination tempera bowl and pork fried rice. Their kim-chi fried rice is awesome as well. The restaurant is quite small inside but still cute enough for a date night.

This place is a merely OK.  4 stars is pretty generous, but it seems that Las Vegas has a bit of star inflation.  If you're hungry and can't drive 0.5 miles elsewhere, it's not bad as long as you don't get your expectations too high.  We ended up getting Cutlet bowl and the crab jumping rice.  It tasted like a mediocre Yoshinoya, and my wife and I left somewhat disappointed but no longer hungry.  

For the cost, you're betting off going to a teriyaki competitor infliced with madness.  For the taste, you could do a lot better elsewhere.  However, if you only have a little bit of time for lunch break and every other place is busy, you could do much worse.

This place is really good  They give great portion for a great price and they have great fast customer service too. My bf and I drove here from Henderson to try and it was definitely worth the drive. We had the chicken mayo bowl, chicken cutlet bowl and spicy tuna roll and we were satisfied with all of it. Hopefully they expand and open one in Henderson in the future  I highly recommend this place and will definitely be coming back to try more on the menu!

Had my first visit here on November 8,2016, and I am the newest number one fan! I ordered the Alaska roll (dragon roll with salmon on top instead of eel) and the poki salad. Both were DELICIOUS. These two items plus a fountain drink (Coke products) totaled $21, so it's a little pricey but I think worth it. The setting is casual, you order at the counter and then they bring the food to you on paper plates.

Came here to try something new and they didn't disappoint. The place was clean and spacious. Parking wasn't hard. Our fave was the crab jumping rice. Worth the price and was a big serving. The screaming O salad was great too. However, we think the dynamite rolls were a bit overpriced. It cost $9 for 4 rolls. The staff was helpful... So overall it was a good experience.

Sooooo!! I remember when this place first opened, and my family and I thought it wouldn't be that good. BUT we were in for the best surprise ever when we went! One word, AMAZING!!! The food was absolutely delicious! Their rice bowls are where it's at! And their sushi! Dang! My favorite is the crispy mayo chicken rice bowl...umm hello it's delicious and comes with fried eggs and sweet sauce! Gosh so good! I even had it postmated a couple times! The dynamite bowl was super yummy too! My family and I became a big fan!  They give the food to you in really good to-go boxes too! My mama uses them for lunch now!
