The price, is so-so because I mean $9 isn't too bad but sometimes you don't wanna spend that money! I totally think it's worth it because I can have left overs for another day! Everything is around that price range and super delicious! 

The customer service, we came late and you could tell the workers didn't wanna be there. At first I thought the girl at the counter wasn't that nice but she ACTUALLY was very helpful and very nice! The cooks were in a rush to leave though which made me question why stay open till 10 if you cook wants to leave by like 9:30-9:45! 

Overall very happy with the food and my experience! I will be back many many times I can promise you that!

We just happen to be in the area as we wanted to check out the rolled ice cream shop next door. But of course we wanted to have dinner first and we saw this place, a Mexican restaurant and the burger joint. Checked it on Yelp and the reviews were pretty good so we went in and was greeted warmly by a lady behind the counter. 

It has a nice concept,  when you get in you place your order,  pay at the counter and take a sit. They bring the food to your table.  You self serve yourself for drinks, they have a drink station. Another thing I like is that your rice order is in a to go box. One order is good for 2 people,  something to think about next time we order,  so I took home my leftover.  The food was very tasty and I can't wait to eat my left over.

I've been meaning to go here for such a long time. I'm so glad I finally did. When you first walk in, you order right away at the register. Then, they bring your food to you at whatever table you choose. The food came out pretty fast. The server did forget my wasabi that I asked for though. But, the food was so delicious that I looked past the fact they forgot my wasabi. Haha. I got;

Dynamite bowl: Made with sushi rice and buttery mushrooms, shrimp, rice cake and scallops. The sauce was soooo good. For anyone who regularly orders dynamite when going out to eat sushi, you must order this! 5/5

Sashimi salad: tuna, super white tuna, salmon, and albacore with mixed greens. All of the fish was super fresh and the salad dressing was perfect. Some places put way too much dressing but I like to enjoy the flavor of the raw fish. 5/5

Rolling #5 roll: shrimp tempura, spicy soft shell crab, and cucumber on the inside. Spicy soft shell crab also on the outside. On top, there was tuna, albacore, shrimp, and red snapper. It comes with a spicy mayo ponzu sauce which I LOVED. I drenched my rolls in that sauce. Sooo good. 5/5 

This place isn't just rice bowls! There's sushi rolls and appetizers and salads! Very good and fresh fish quality so for all you fish lovers, come check this place out :)

Everything I've ever order from here has been absolutely delicious! The amount of food you get for the price is great. My favorite is the Crispy Chicken Mayo Bowl. I love the staff that works here & they get my business multiple times a month because it's just that good.

I was highly impressed with this place for a couple of reasons. 1) Most things on the menu costed $9 2) I ordered the crab jumping fried rice and they were very generous with the amount they give you, and typically a good crab fried rice is way more expensive for less 3)They give you additional miso soup and salad during lunch time 4) Fast and friendly service

It's really nice to see a semi-casual, affordable restaurant that specializes in delicious rice dishes along with having such a large amount of other menu items like sashimi salads and teriyaki bowls.

I've never been to a place like this in Vegas. Was super far from my house but why not go on a mission to a new food place? You order first then sit wherever you want and you get your own drinks and then they bring you your food. We had a spider roll first which was pretty good, could have been a little more flavorful. Then our crab rice bowls arrived and it smelled amazing. Couldn't wait to dig in. It's a very good portion for what you pay, lots of meat not like other places where they barely give you any. I couldn't even finish it all so of course I took it to go! I will be back!

Quick and easy... nothing complicated about this place at all. It's open late, has beer and wine, enough variety to satisfy anyone in your group who enjoys standard Asian fare, and pictures of their menu items to help you decide what to have.

Had the Indonesian jumping rice with shrimp, miso soup, sashimi salad... and Sapporo on tap... all delicious and fresh tasting. If I lived in the area, I'd be a regular. Thanks for the great experience!

Pretty disappointed at how small the rolls turned out to be, looks like a small kids sized roll to me. I always tip even when I'm doing take out, but I feel like I shouldn't have, I paid nearly $12 for a mini sushi roll. Won't be coming back.

This place is AWESOME. Is it Korean owned? A lot of workers were speaking Korean when I went there and that only adds to its awesomeness. Lol We ordered the Crab Fried Rice, The Pineapple Seafood Fried Rice, and the Screaming O Salad to go. It was all delicious but the Crab Fried Rice was really something else! It was exceptionally good with big chunks of real crab. I can't wait to come back and order that again and try some of their other menu items. Their sushi rolls looked really good too! 

Also, is really nice inside if you decide to dine in!

Came here yesterday as a random find on Yelp and glad we went!

We got the crispy chicken mayo bowl and spicy bowl with pork (both with white rice). Luckily we came during the lunch special time and got a serving of miso soup and salad each. 
Both entrees were really good, I definitely recommend the crispy chicken mayo bowl! :) 

The ladies were nice and friendly. Restaurant is clean. Prices are really good. No complaints here~
I will be coming here again the in future (^0^)

The screaming o salad was pretty good. However I did not enjoy the cucumber island roll. I was very disappointed after seeing such good reviews. The service was good, friendly and quick. However, I would probably choose another place for sushi.

I love this jumping rice & roll! Fast food sushi palace!  Amazing flavors and food! 
I'm a huge Sushi Fever fan, been going there for years,( tried every sushi place in town) but I don't always have the time for sit-down lunch or dinners.Today was a busy business day and I decided to Yelp around for sushi on the go! Came across this interesting place, had to stop in and get some food on my way home.i stopped in @ 9:45pm and the lady at the register was super nice, she did not turn me down because they close at 10pm. She was very patient as I was reading the picture menu and asking questions, I had never been here before. 
10 minutes later Vola I had my order...

Best shrimp tempura in town! Finished the 3 shrimps on the way home! They could use a bit of change on the sweet sauce that comes with it for a more homemade authentic sauce but no matter shrimp was light, crispy and fluffy as tempura should be! 
Next I had the screaming O...perfection to flavor and taste! For a fast food the tuna is very fresh, well season, not spicy & delicious! I was impressed ! Finished the whole thing. 

I was hungry so I also ordered the soft shell crab with rice (crab jumping rice)
Delicious ! Very well cooked almost gourmet! A little less oil on the rice and a sauce for the crab and you would think you are at a great sushi restaurant !!

Impressed with the fast food sushi idea and its flavors. I will definitely be back.

Good food! Great selection. Theres something for everyone here. The jumping rice (fried rice) is excellent. Everything is fresh and fast. Staff isn't the friendliest but they aren't rude either. Definitely plan to return on our next trip!

Menu is good, Food always tastes good and they have good portions too but they've raised their prices and I understand the cost of things but they've become a little over priced for lunch now. There are comparable places nearby that have better lunch specials for the price. I love the food here, I just won't come as often for lunch on the weekends anymore.

Not exactly a hole in the wall but I took a chance on this place. So lets be quick. Went out for burgers but stopped here instead. I have no regrets. The mayo chicken rice bowl and the sashimi salad filled up me and my GF up came out to around $26 with two drinks. The fish was fresh and melts in your mouth as any fresh sashimi should. The Mayo chicken bowl was delicious, as if i was eating chicken katsu bites with a tangy sweet twist to it.

There fried rice with angus beef is soooooo good! Most of their sushis are also good. I have never ordered anything and disliked it. I have always liked everything i have ordered. Its fresh and good! Cute place and great service. Im glad its right by our house!

I love this place. I actually got the menu so I can order and pick up food. The soft crab fried rice is so good. I'm going to be ordering from here weekly and trying everything !!!! The lady who helped me was really nice too. This place is a gem  enjoy

A-OK, and that's all folks! Food is quick and tasty. Although the food quality is less than what you pay for. This spot can get pretty pricey, so beware what you order. Service isn't a strong point of this spot, but it isn't a luxurious restaurant, it's a hole in the whole food spot. There isn't much to choose from at the drink dispenser and the decor is appealing although it's usually dirty. My table is sticky every time I've dined here.

Pros: Good location, variety of food, appealing decor

Cons: dirty tables, a little pricey, needs better customer service, no wifi

Overall: I'd eat here again although not as my first choice. Not one of my favorite places, but I wouldn't turn down an invitation if someone else was buying. Wouldn't spend my own money here again.

Just a bit too oily for my liking, but nonetheless- I love the variety of bowls. And the garlic edamame is delicious! 
It's way across town, but worth a visit :)

I went for a late lunch on Saturday, no other patrons. Hmmm. Interesting. My confidence for stopping in, between errands, was waning. But, nice decor. New and clean. Counter Service. 2 Asian gals in charge at the counter.  Based on their recommendation, I ordered the spicy basil fried rice (jumping rice) with chicken. The portion was a good size but for $12 I think it should be. I'm not sure that I've ever paid $12 for chicken basil fried rice even at a trendy Thai restaurant in San Francisco.

I think the flavor was great albeit spicy (so not for everyone). It includes finely chopped fresh veggies, and large and smaller pieces of chicken, basil and many chili peppers (that I picked out and did not eat because there was plenty of spice going, no need to eat them). I ate about 1/3. But got to, and bit into, a large piece of chicken, that was not cooked all the way through. I spit it out. I used my fork to cut into another large piece. It wasn't cooked through either. The smaller pieces were though. I ate those. I took the remaining rice to go. I did not complain, because I knew when I warmed it up for a snack later, the chicken pieces would cook through. I ate leftovers later that evening. After 60 seconds in microwave, all was good.

Will I go back? Probably not because for the money there are many other good Asian places.

A place that don't have good service just is not good I called at 945 and this Hispanic Girl answered she had a huge attitude I felt like telling her off but didn't but love the jumping rice noodles with chicken GET RID OF THAT CHICK!!!
Stopped by for a quick dinner tonight. Was fast and delicious! Great quality sushi rolls and rice bowls. Definitely will go again.

One of our favorite spots!! We have never had bad service, they are always the nicest and can't do enough for you! The food is so fresh and tasty, my boyfriend and I love the Raman Soup (big enough to share) and spicy edamame. My favorite roll is the Salmon blossom or the Salmon mini bowl.. delicious!! We love this little hidden gem

I was kind of expecting a full service type place, but the food was reasonably priced and tasted good enough. I'd go back for lunch or for a quick bite. The counter person was very nice and efficient.

The seaweed salad and the Tuna Poke is delicious.  However, I ordered a roll with spicy tuna on the outside and a crab mixture on the inside and it was neither fresh nor tuna.  It was a ground up mixture of tuna and salmon and it was not good.  The service is wonderful, so I may return, but will no longer order any of the rolls.  I did tell the server and she apologized but made no effort to make any alterations or offer anything else instead of the salmon/tuna mixture.

Love this place! Always fresh and delicious. It's different than your regular sushi/noodle place which is nice. Favorite dish is the Thai pineapple rice. You can choose what type of rice or noodles you want for each dish. They also have online ordering for pickup which is very convenient.

Love this place when im feeling lazy to go to a sit down sushi restaurant and want some rolls fast to take home.  Prices are really good for sushi rolls and they are pretty good you just have to order the right things.  Recommend if you live in the area!

We wanted a quick lunch so we stopped by this place after seeing great yelp reviews. We ordered miso soup, a tuna tango roll and Indonesian jumping noodle dish. The roll was good, fresh, light. The soup was delicious! I even commented to my husband that I need to learn how to make it. And the noodles were good too. Slightly on the salty side. Very saucy so you can't really escape it. But I would come back again for a other quick lunch on my way to shopping of something like that :)

Quality fast food Japanese restaurant at a great price. The hardest part is deciding what to order because everything looks, sounds and tastes delicious! If you want fine-dining Japanese food without the pretentiousness, then I suggest you stop by here.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!
First I must say the rolls were amazing! The best I ever had in Las Vegas. 
Secondly the staff were friendly and very attentive.
I'm in love with jumping rice~

I had doubts about entering this place Becuase I thought it was just a spot for sushi rolls entree but I was wrong. Came in to look at the menu and it was a quick service spot. You order your meal at the counter and have a seat. They offer rice bowls and other variety of food. I had the chicken bowl with egg. I can say it was outstanding for the price of $10. I also ordered the salmon Pok√© for $9. Both entrees were good and had plenty leftover to take home which was a plus.

Been here 2 times so far on my own. It's a order at counter then bring to you kind of place or take out. The decor is very nice and comfortable. When you stay to eat they bring you nice dishes. Everything I've ordered so far has been delicious. I got the crab noodle bowl last time and miso soup. So filling. This time I got the screaming O salad and a California roll. All very good. 

Only negative thing is that the girls at the counter could be a little more friendly. They don't say much.

Tried this place over the weekend. We will definitely be back. We split a shrimp tornado roll, crab rice bowl and chicken mayo bowl. Could not finish half of it between the two of us. Only 2 things could have been better. There was only one poor girl working the entire front on a Friday night. She was so overwhelmed that it took forever to get our food out. By the time it reached us, the chicken mayo bowl was cold. We will try to come at a less busy time and see if this resolves.
Love the food, and the ease of ordering on line. They are always very nice and have my food done quickly. The lunch specials are awesome!

We are in desperate need of a good sushi restaurant in the area...when they first opened thought they would fit the bill.

Sadly they have not maintained their original promise.

The rolls are loose, average in flavor and way over priced.

Stoll looking for my local place.

Four words. Spicy. Basil. Jumping. Rice. The crab was actually really good too.  

I really love how the restaurant is super casual and not a sit down restaurant. I loved that the service was fast and the cashier girl came to check up on us. 


I will def be coming back to try other things.
Always generous portions of rice. Thai pineapple is hands down the best! Tuna tango is also another must try. Love it!

This place is pretty bomb, came here with the gf and we had a great visit here, ordered a dynamite bowl with white rice, gf ordered a jumping crab bowl. The food is very tasty; every bite of the dynamite bowl seemed to keep tasting better, and the fried rice tasted great too! Will be coming back!

This just...wasn't very good.

The food comes in a box that resembles a microwave dinner box...and that's basically what it tastes like, in terms of flavor and quality. I had a spicy bowl, which I guess was spicy...somewhat...and...well, I can't say much more about it. It was...a meal. Meat, onions and rice. It came with a little bit of miso soup and a salad with ginger sauce and not-very-appealing lettuce. I guess this is what they call fusion? It's vaguely Korean. A fusion of Korean and garbage. Without anything good from Korean cuisine. So it's garbagean. Emphasis on garbage.

Honestly, I've had tastier and higher quality meals that I've heated in my microwave.

On the plus side, the serving size is large, and...well, that's about all I can say in terms of positives.

Edit: really didn't feel too well after letting it digest. Ugh. Disgusting garbage food.

My go to place for a quick fried rice craving. I love that they have different types of rice that I can choose from, so they specifically cook it for me. 

I ordered a crab jumbing rice and it always taste the same. I love how this is a privately own restaurant and how they can maintain their consistency in each dish that they serve.

They are a little pricey for me, but I can usually get two meals out of the order so I will make a stop every once in a while.

Good food, always fresh ingredients. Fast & friendly service, don't be dismayed by the walk up order counter, they have a nice modern restaurant style seating in the back area. Great for casual style dining.

Out of all the places we visited for meals while in Vegas, the 3 cheapest places had the best food. 
This place was found thanks to wonderful Yelp reviews. 
This place seemed clean and had a nice decor. The girl behind the counter was sweet and attentive. The menu had so many choices, it took my Wife and I about 15 min to make a decision. 
I ordered a spider roll and a rice bowl w pork belly (yeah, now I have your attention). The spider roll was HUGE, nicely presented and very tasty. The rice bowl was also a HUGE portion, it was a rd under seasoned which was fixes w/ a nice drizzle of siracha. 
My wife ordered a Philly roll and a middle bowl w chicken. The roll was big and loaded w salmon, the noodle bowl was also a big portion. 
Bc  we were unaware of the portion sizes we also ordered some gyoza to share as an app. After woofing them down, then each of our rolls, we barely made a dent in our main dishes, not to worry, we brought them home and had them for dinner. 

Great place, service, food and prices. 
Check them out.

Food was decent.. definitely looked better than how it tasted.. kinda dead when I came in. More of an asian fast food place but kinda pricey for being fast food. First time here. Saw the great reviews but was far from impressed. Oh well.. glad to have tried it, but luckily living in vegas, there isnt a shortage of new restaurants.

Got take out here the other day. I have never dined in. 

My mom and I had the shrimp noodles. My mom is a fan of the food here, and decided to bring me here. Wait wasn't long (around 10 mins) till the food was ready to pick up. 

Noodle was okay, my mom is a huge fan of the shrimp noodle here. 

If you're looking for comfort food in the area. I recommend checking this spot out, close to 215. 

Casual dining. Parking lot.
Love the mini rice bowls and Rolley rice bowl - we are here usually twice a week! Everything tastes fresh and my girls love the salmon mini bowl.

Eeesshhhh.... it's kind of hard to mess up miso soup but this place managed to do just that.   I actually came here on a second date trying to convince this person that Asian food is good.   This was his first time having miso soup and he vowed to never eat it again.   Yikes!   But honestly if it were my first time I'd not eat it again either.  The flavor was off like there was something rotten in it and it wasn't hot when we got it.   There were also items floating around inside that I did not recognize. 

The rest of the meal was ok.  I got a salmon skin salad.   It was seriously salty and there was so much dressing.   It was hard to get through. 

The restaurant itself was a little sad looking.  It was dirty and the lighting was bad.   It felt a little like being in a scary movie. 

The reason it doesn't get 1 star is the ladies who work there are very friendly and nice. 

Definitely not coming back...

Great place for fast Japanese food. My favorite dish is the crab fried rice. Tasty n filling. They put a whole soft shell crab on top and also mix in crab Into the rice . You get to choose what kind of rice you want : white, Jasmine or brown. I always say light on the oil which they do. Fast n convenient.

This place used to be much better, lately I have not been happy with their service or quality of food. I ordered a rainbow roll to go today, it was tiny!! Half the size as an all you can eat place roll! See my pic. Fish isn't very fresh either. Are you serious? Errr, I really need to go to another place to order.
Delicious! Found this awesome gem and will definitely come again! New addiction!! A must-go!! :)
I ordered the crab fried rice and my friend had the kim chee fried rice. They were both good but the price wasn't. I thought it was a little too high.

This not your fancy sushi joint, but for what it is, it's a great spot for a quick, made to order asian meal on a budget. We got the sashimi salad, beef teriyaki bowl, crab jumping rice and one of the sushi rolls, each for $9. It is OTC ordering, so service and atmosphere is limited but courteous and casual. 

Overall, it was very tasty, particularly the crab rice and sashimi salad. The rice was full of shredded snow crab and abundant friedsoftshell on  top. The salad was topped with plenty of colorful assorted fish (8), and the ponzu dressing was refreshing and flavorful. My daughter loved the beef teriyaki and ate it rather quickly without the usual prodding. The roll was unremarkable. Not bad, but I personally wouln't come here for the sushi. The other dishes were enough for me to recommend this place for its taste, quality, and value.

I have to say ehhhh.   We've been to Jumping Rice several times since they opened.  The rice is always delicious and we eat too much of it.  

On the sushi rolls however, they are a little disappointing.  Flavors are good but they are never rolled tight enough and they almost always fall apart.  We thought it was just because they were new but now it's every time. 

Don't know if we'll be back....

Quality of food and customer service has improved a lot that's why I am updating my review. So far my favorite dishes are still the pork belly jumping rice and the crunchy chicken mayo rice.... hmm yummy. You can also havr them substitute white rice for brown rice :)The sushi is also delicious and the baked green mussells. Definitely a place I will be frequenting.

Jumping Rice & Rolls is a quick service Asian restaurant with decent food and service.

I arrived here on a Saturday afternoon and they were pretty empty. You order at the counter and they bring your food out to your table. 

They have a variety of fried rides and noodles as well as sushi rolls, salads and appetizers. I opted the kim chee fried noodles and tried the salmon roll.  

The entree serving size was generous for the price. I had plenty left over for a second meal to take home with me. The noodles we're decent and had a nice kick. The salmon roll was not memorable but I didn't expect too much. I would stick with the hot items from their menu and it's great for takeout too.

I'd be interested to check out more of their menu in the future.
Better than I expected. The service, food and selection are all worth noting. I will definitely be back to try everything else.

Food is average! I wont recommend this place if you are really hungry. My wife and I ordered vegie bowl and teriyaki.. I thought i was going to get alot of veggie but i was so disappointed and got so much rice than veggies. Other than the food i give 5 stars for their service.
